The Childs Psalm

If a child lives with criticism
- he learns to condemn.

If a child lives with hostility
- he learns to fight.

If a child lives with ridicule
- he learns to be shy.

If a child lives with shame
- he learns to feel guilty.

If a child lives with tolerance
- he learns to be patient.

If a child lives with encouragement
- he learns confidence.

If a child lives with praise
- he learns to appreciate.

If a child lives with fairness
- he learns justice.

If a child lives with security
- he learns to have faith.

If a child lives with approval
- he learns to like himself.

If a child lives with acceptance and friendship
He learns to find love in the world.

Athroniaeth

Mae'r ysgol yn bodoli i ddathlu cyflawniadau plant ac i’w datblygu fel unigolion sydd yn gwerthfawrogi eu hamgylchfyd yn ei gyfanrwydd. Rhoddir pwys ar ddatblygu gwerthoedd moesol a dyngarol, gan feithrin hunan-barch a goddefgarwch tuag at eraill. Ymdrechir i sicrhau bod pob disgybl yn teimlo’n hapus a diogel o fewn cymdeithas ddisgybledig sy’n rhoi bri yn ei bywyd a’i gwaith.

Rhoddir pwyslais ar gynnal a chodi safonau cyflawniad disgyblion ym mhob maes cwricwlaidd, er mwyn rhoi’r cyfle i bob disgybl gyrraedd ei lawn botensial, ond rhaid cofio bod cyfrifoldeb gan yr ysgol am fwy nag addysgu’r plant a dylid meddwl amdanynt yn eu cyfanrwydd, fel bodau unigryw a chanddynt eu hanghenion arbennig eu hunain. Mae angen felly datblygu gwerthfawrogiad o'r moesol, y moesgar, y corfforol a’r diwylliannol ac o etifeddiaeth, o draddodiadau ac o iaith y genedl Gymreig a'i lle yn, a'i pherthynas gyda gweddill y byd.

Er mwyn cyflawni hyn rhaid sicrhau bod pob plentyn yn cael cyfle cyfartal ar draws y cwricwlwm. Cyflwynir cwricwlwm eang, cytbwys a chyfoethog i’r plant, gan gynnig iddynt brofiadau real a chyfoethog. Defnyddir dulliau dysgu ac addysgu ac adnoddau o’r ansawdd uchaf, fydd yn cynorthwyo disgyblion i ddatblygu meddyliau ymchwilgar a bywiog, y gallu i gwestiynu a thrafod yn rhesymegol, i ddatrys problemau real ac i weithio'n annibynnol. Ymdrechir i wneud hyn o fewn cynefin ac awyrgylch agored, croesawgar, chwaethus, hapus, teuluol a chartrefol.

Golyga hyn fod y plant yn cael eu hysbrydoli ac er mwyn iddynt gyrraedd a chyflawni eu llawn potensial rhaid addysgu plentyn i addysgu ei hun drwy roi rhan weithredol iddi/o yn y broses honno. Rhaid pwysleisio'r pwysigrwydd o roi clust a sylw teilwng i bawb, gan bawb, a hefyd i blant gael cyfle i ymateb yn synhwyrol a gydag ymresymiad personol i amrywiol gynulleidfaoedd.

Mae'n hanfodol bwysig parchu plant, eu syniadau a'u cynnyrch, drwy rannu eu llwyddiannau ag eraill, a datblygu hunan barch a hyder drwy osod esiampl o'r safon uchaf bosibl.

Er mwyn cyflawni'r hyn oll mae'n rhaid cynllunio'n drwyadl polisïau, cynlluniau a dulliau dysgu ysgol gyfan a dosbarthiadau unigol, wedi ymgynghoriad rhwng a gyda'r athrawon, y llywodraethwyr a'r A.A.Ll

Philosophy

The school exists to celebrate the children’s' achievements and to develop them as individuals who appreciate their environment in its entirety. The development of moral and philanthropic values, as well as self –esteem and tolerance towards others is encouraged. We strive to ensure that each pupil feels happy and secure within a disciplined community, which puts great value in its life and work.

Importance is put on maintaining and raising children’s achievement standards, so that each individual is given the opportunity to achieve his/her full potential, but it must be remembered that the school has a responsibility for more than just teaching children, which means that the children must be considered in their entirety, as unique beings with their own individual needs. It is therefore also necessary to develop an appreciation of the moral, the mannerly, the physical and the cultural, and an understanding of the inheritance, traditions and language of the Welsh nation, and its place in, and relationship to the rest of the world.

In order to achieve this it is necessary to ensure that each child has equal opportunities across the curriculum. The children are offered a varied, balanced and enriched curriculum, with real experiences of the highest possible quality. Teaching and learning techniques and resources of the highest possible quality are used, which encourage children to develop inquisitive and lively minds, the ability to question and to discuss sensibly, to solve problems and to work independently. We strive to do this within an open, welcoming, tasteful, happy, family and homely environment and atmosphere.

This results in children who are inspired and in order that each child achieves his/her full potential, the children must be educated to take an active part in this process. It is necessary to emphasise the importance of listening to what children have to say, and that everyone gives each child his/her deserved attention, and that each child be given the opportunity to react sensibly and with personal reasoning to varying audiences.

It is essential that each child and his/her ideas and produce be respected, by sharing their successes with others, by developing self-respect and confidence and by setting an example of the highest possible quality.

In order to achieve all this, it is necessary to prepare thoroughly, policies, whole school and class schemes and teaching techniques, after consultation within and between the staff, governors and LEA.

Llywodraethwyr / Governors

Mae modd i rieni i ofyn am hyd at 3 chyfarfod gyda Chorff Llywodraethu mewn unrhyw flwyddyn ysgol, i drafod materion sy’n peri pryder iddynt. Bydd rhaid bodloni 4 gofyniad:
Bydd angen i rieni gyflwyno deiseb o blaid cynnal cyfarfod.

  • Bydd angen i rieni o leiaf 10% o ddisgyblion cofrestredig yr ysgol / 30 o ddisgyblion cofrestredig lofnodi’r ddeiseb.
  • Rhaid galw’r cyfarfod i drafod materion sy’n effeithio ar yr ysgol.
  • Ceir cynnal uchafswm o 3 chyfarfod yn ystod y flwyddyn ysgol.
  • Rhaid bod o leiaf 25 o ddiwrnodau ysgol ar ôl yn y flwyddyn ysgol.

Parents mat request up to 3 meetings with the Governing Body in any school year, to discuss issues that concern them. 4 requirements must be met:
Parents will need to submit a petition in favor of holding a meeting.

  • Parents of at least 10% of the registered pupils at the school / 30 pupils must sign the petition.
  • The meeting must be called to discuss issues affecting the school.
  • A maximum of 3 meetings may be conducted during the school year.
  • There must be at least 25 school days left in the school year.

Gwisg Ysgol

Mae gan yr ysgol hon wisg ysgol swyddogol. Mae'r wisg yn cynnwys crys polo glas } golau/crys t, crys chwys glas tywyll/hwdi, sgert neu drowsus llwyd/du, (dim trowsusau chwaraeon na jîns) ac esgidiau neu drainyrs addas. Ni chaniateir sodlau na fflipfflops.

Yn yr Haf caniateir gwisgo trowsus byr neu dri-chwarter llwyd/du neu ffrog las a gwyn (gingham) i'r genethod.
Disgwylir i'r plant fod wedi eu gwisgo'n lân a thrwsiadus, a bod eu dillad yn cydymffurfio â’r wisg ysgol. Gofynnwn yn garedig am eich cefnogaeth gyda'r wisg ysgol.
Gellir archebu crysau polo/crysau t a chrysau chwys/hwdis drwy’r ysgol unwaith y tymor.

Cyfrifoldeb rhieni yw sicrhau bod enw eu plentyn wedi ei bwytho/ysgrifennu ar bob dilledyn y mae’n ei wisgo neu’n newid iddo fel rhan o weithgareddau’r ysgol.

Ni chaniateir gwisgo clustlysau yn yr ysgol ag eithrio 'stỳds'.

School Uniform

This school has an official uniform. The uniform includes a light blue polo shirt/t-shirt, a dark blue sweatshirt/hoodie, grey/black skirt or trousers, (not sports trousers or jeans), and suitable shoes or trainers. Heels and flip-flops are not permitted.

In the summer the children can wear grey/ black shorts/three quarter length trousers or a blue and white gingham dress for the girls.
The children are expected to be neatly dressed in clothes, which conform to the school uniform. We respectfully request your co-operation with the school uniform. Polo/T shirts and sweatshirts/hoodies may be ordered through the school once a term.

It is the parent’s responsibility to ensure that their child's name is sewn/written on each piece of clothing worn or changed into as part of the school's activities.

The wearing of earrings is not permitted in school, with the exception of 'studs'

Cyfle Cyfartal


  • Yn unol â Deddf Cysylltiadau Hiliol (Diwygiedig) 2000, mae’r ysgol wedi ymrwymo i hyrwyddo cyfleoedd cyfartal, i hyrwyddo cysylltiadau da rhwng aelodau gwahanol grwpiau a chymunedau hiliol, diwylliannol a chrefyddol ac i gael gwared â gwahaniaethu anghyfreithlon ar sail hil neu ryw.
  • Datblygir disgyblion Ysgol Bethel heb ganiatáu i’w rhyw, hil neu unrhyw nodweddion personol eraill fod yn rhwystr i hynny. Yn yr un modd cyflogir unigolion heb ganiatáu i’w rhyw, hil neu unrhyw nodweddion personol eraill fod yn rhwystr i hynny.
  • Darperir cydraddoldeb cyfle yn yr ysgol i ddisgyblion a staff, dysgu ac atodol.
  • Datblygir cydraddoldeb cyfle a pharch yn yr ysgol rhwng bechgyn a genethod, rhwng oedolion, rhwng plant ac oedolion a’r gwrthwyneb.
  • Ehangir gorwelion bechgyn a genethod drwy greu amgylchedd lle ni cheir gwahaniaethu ar sail rhyw a lle herir ystrydebau traddodiadol.
  • Hyrwyddir cyfleoedd cyfartal i ferched a bechgyn ar draws y cwricwlwm. Nid yw’r athrawon na’r staff atodol yn gosod disgwyliadau gwahanol i ferched a bechgyn.
  • Mae’n anghyfreithlon ym Mhrydain Fawr i wahaniaethu o ran rhyw wrth benodi, diswyddo neu’n dyrchafu swyddi. Sicrheir bod Ysgol Bethel yn glynu wrth yr Erthyglau Llywodraethu a’r Ddeddf Gwahaniaethu ar Sail Rhyw 1975 wrth benodi staff.
  • Mabwysiadwyd polisi Cydraddoldeb Hiliol gan yr ysgol, sydd yn nodi ymrwymiad yr ysgol i hyrwyddo cyfle cyfartal, hyrwyddo cysylltiadau da rhwng aelodau gwahanol grwpiau a chymunedau hiliol, diwylliannol a chrefyddol ac i osgoi gwahaniaethau anghyfreithlon.
  • Ni adroddwyd ar unrhyw achos o hiliaeth yn yr ysgol.

Equal Opporunities


  • According to the (amended) Race Relations Act 2000, the school is commited to promote equal opportunities, to promote good relations between members of different cultural, ethnic and religious groups and to be free of any illegal differentiation based on race or sex.
  • The children of Ysgol Bethel are developed without allowing their sex, race or any other personal characteristics to influence that development. In the same way, individuals are employed ensuring that their sex, race or any personal characteristics do not influence any appointments.
  • Equal opportunities are offered at the school to children and staff, teaching and ancillary.
  • Equal opportunities and respect are fostered and developed at the school between boys and girls, between adults, between children and adults and vice-versa.
  • Both girls’ and boys’ horizons are expanded in an atmosphere which does not differentiate according to sex and which challenges traditional concepts.
  • Equal opportunities across the curriculum are encouraged for boys and girls. The teaching and ancillary staff does not set different expectations for boys and girls.
  • It is unlawful in the United Kingdom to differentiate according to sex when appointing, dismissing or promoting staff. Ysgol Bethel adopts the Governing Articles and the 1975 Sex Discrimination Act when appointing staff.
  • The School has adopted a Racial Equality Policy, which involves promoting equal opportunities, promoting good relationships with members of different racial, cultural and religious groups and communities, and avoiding illegal differentiation.
  • No case of racial discrimination has been reported at the school.

Cyswllt â Rhieni

Gweithredir polisi 'drws agored' yn yr ysgol lle mae rhyddid a chroeso i rieni, drwy drefnu apwyntiad ymlaen llaw, i ymweld â'r ysgol i drafod unrhyw agwedd ar addysg, lles neu hapusrwydd eu plant. Rydym i gyd yn cydweithio er lles pob plentyn yn yr ysgol.
Gwahoddir rhieni i'r ysgol i weld a thrafod gwaith a datblygiad eu plant ddwywaith y flwyddyn, yn nhymor yr Hydref a thymor yr Haf. Hefyd gwahoddir rhieni a chyfeillion yr ysgol i fynychu cyngherddau, a.y.b. i wylio’r plant yn perfformio. Gwahoddir rhieni i wasanaeth diwedd blwyddyn yn flynyddol.

Links with Parents

The school follows an 'open door' policy where any parent is welcome, through prior arrangement, to visit the school to discuss any matter relating to their child's education, welfare or happiness. We all work together for the benefit of each and every child at the school.
Parents are invited to the school to see and discuss their child's work and development twice a year, in the Autumn and Summer terms. Parents and friends of the school are also invited to attend concerts etc. to watch the children perform. Parents are invited to an annual end of year service.
